text: well here in Moscow there's growing
concern that the US and our allies are
planning to launch a strike against
Syria the president holds Syria and
Russia responsible so how will Russia
retaliate
well that depends I think on the scale
of any US missile attack on the targets
which are chosen and on the potential
for Russian casualties it sounds like
all options are on the table back in
March the chief of the General Staff of
the Russian armed forces said that if
there was going to be a US missile
strike against Syria
and if there were going to be Russian
casualties then Russia would respond by
shooting down US missiles and also
delivery systems well we do know that
the Russian military does have
surface-to-air missile systems in place
across Syria we don't know if they'd be
prepared to use them against us missiles
and we don't know how effective they
would be
well I think the good news is that
neither Russia nor America wants war
these are two nuclear powers and they
both understand that there can be no
winner the bad news though is that there
is so much rhetoric and saber rattling
of both sides and there is always the
danger in in this situation I think of
an accidental clash an accidental
confrontation which could become a
larger country
